intro: Convolvulus cephalanthus, commonly known as the yellow morning glory, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, trumpet-shaped yellow flowers that open in the morning. Its flowers are followed by capsule fruits that contain several seeds. The plant is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a common sight in arid and semi-arid regions.
